p: All subtypes of H1-H16 and N1-N9 can be found amongst wild birds, however, only limited combinations of HA/NA occur frequently in nature whereas others rarely emerge, not to mention those infecting humans [ 86, 87, 88, 89]. Laboratory attempts to produce viable reassortant viruses bearing particular subtype combinations also failed [ 90]. These results suggest some stringent requirements for the match between HA and NA.
